title: WCAS KOREAN 111-3-20 Korean I

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This is a year-long course in fist-year Korean designed for beginning learners. This course is designed to develop students' all-around communicative skills in speaking, listening, reading and writing with a great emphasis placed on developing a conversational skill. The objective of the course is to learn the basic communication skill in light with cultural appropriateness in the target language.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: None for Fall Quarter; Completion of 111-1 or a departmental placement test for Winter Quarter; Completion of 111-2 or a departmental placement test for Spring Quarter

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value: Students will learn the basic elements of Korean language such as vocabulary, conjugation, and sentence structure and practice speaking, reading, writing and listening. This class is student-centered and students' active participation is very important. Also, various kinds of reading and video materials will be provided to enhance students' reading and listening skills as well as the cultural understanding

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Grade will be based on attendance and participation, vocabulary quizzes and lesson tests, assignments, oral tests and performance, final examination.
